sense.name: a costume that provides a pretend identity
sense.examples: This eye patch, dagger and kerchief are part of John's pirate disguise. In operas, characters often wear disguises to masquerade as other characters. Even in her disguise as Cleopatra, I still recognized Mary.

sense.name: a state of pretending to be someone, something else
sense.commentary: DISGUISE[+state][+semblance][+outward][+pretense] Note: focus is on a result or state of pretense, not an activity
sense.examples: The kids thought the man was a narcotics agent in disguise. It was actually a blessing in disguise. (somewhat figurative extension) He threw off his disguise of aloofness and showed his real passion for the project.

sense.name: the activity of pretending to be someone or something else
sense.commentary: DISGUISE[+activity][+ongoing][+pretending] Note: focus is on ongoing activity
sense.examples: Rows of small children looked at her without disguise. His government has engaged in too many disguises and subterfuges to be believed now. Her deferential behavior towards the boss was a disguise that fooled no one in the office.
